decks.notes: This deck focuses on using Niv-Mizzet Reborn as the centerpiece of a control strategy, utilizing a variety of multi-colored cards to control the board and out-value opponents. The deck includes a diverse range of spells and creatures to deal with different threats, along with powerful utility lands and cards like Bring to Light to fetch key cards. The inclusion of Leyline Binding and Ancient Cornucopia helps to stabilize the board while Niv-Mizzet Reborn acts as a source of card advantage and threat to close out the game. The companion Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value and flexibility.

The key concept of the deck is to assemble the combo of Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to create a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Duress to control the opponent's hand, as well as removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse to deal with threats. With a mix of aggressive creatures and powerful vehicles, the deck aims to establish dominance on the battlefield and quickly close out the game.

The main focus of this aggressive red deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of direct damage spells, efficient creatures, and aggressive combat tricks. By utilizing powerful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Kumano Faces Kakkazan, along with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Mutavault and Ramunap Ruins provide extra reach and resilient threats, ensuring a relentless assault on the opponent's life total.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on early game aggression and disruption, utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Blightstep Pathway to control the board while quickly bringing down the opponent's life total. With a mix of efficient removal spells and powerful creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, cards like Fear of Missing Out and Torch the Tower provide additional reach and finishers to end the game decisively.
